intro: Stylogyne glomeruliflora, commonly known as the clustered-flowered stylogyne, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a slightly hairy texture. Stylogyne glomeruliflora thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats.
